page.title: 11RAILWAYS
page.content: {The Darlington and Barnard Castle {Railway {By Paul Griffiths and Joanna Hoare The railway behind Jedburgh drive has been closed down for twenty years.It opened in the eighteen fifties and closed in the nineteen sixties.It was used to carry passengers to Barnard Castle and goods to the chemical works.Now no one cares about it any more they just throw old rags and furniture away.There are lots of bolts and the wooden sleepers.There are lots of chairs which are things that hold the track together.At West Auckland Road the old bridge has been knocked down because it would fall down and some people could have an accident.At the other side of West Auckland Road where all the works are there is still some railway track.
